WorkItem.Description:
Please see http://cwysc.org/
 
Notice that 'Upcoming Events' & 'Recent Blog Posts' are not aligned with 'Recent news'.  I remove one 'Recent news' then it is OK.
How can I fix this?
 
Thanks
 
Dan

Comments.Message:
I am seeing the same effect. The rendered source show that the news, events and blogs blocks are not staying as independent divs inside the wrapper of <div id="columnright">. The second two are being rendered inside the first div and so is the bottom nav. It looks like you saw this to some extent and applied <div class="clearlist"> and <div class="clear2column"> to break out of the wrapper at the end.

The repeater class seems to be in some way causing this as the divs render normally if the repeater is taken out. When you add data and the repeater operates is seems to corrupt the div structure.

I did not notice this happening in the other sites listed as using the v2.

This problems seems to happen in IE7 and Firefox 2

Attached is an image of the home page with this formatting issue.
Same here: http://www/troop483.com. Does anyone have a fix? FYI: In FireFox 3 it looks fine.
